posts.post_content: If you play this on turn 2, play a [Necroplasm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Necroplasm) on turn 3 to wipe the tokens. Alternatively, cast both on turn 5 (or sooner if you have acceleration) to get rid of the tokens immediately.

Posted By: zaftula (10/11/2009 10:44:05 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Clearly a net gain even if you can't easily get rid of one or more of the Centaurs, and amazing for the cost if you can. A splash of red should do the trick, especially with Lightning Bolt back in Extended. This should be played more.  
  
@Bamboonickel: You are mistaken. If not otherwise specified, tokens have names which are the same as their creature type. These tokens are both named "Centaur" and would thus legend-kill each other with Leyline of Singularity in play.
posts.html:
Clearly a net gain even if you can't easily get rid of one or more of the Centaurs, and amazing for the cost if you can. A splash of red should do the trick, especially with Lightning Bolt back in Extended. This should be played more.

@Bamboonickel: You are mistaken. If not otherwise specified, tokens have names which are the same as their creature type. These tokens are both named "Centaur" and would thus legend-kill each other with Leyline of Singularity in play.

posts.post_content: Two of the cheaper ways to get around its drawback are [Whiplash Trap](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Whiplash Trap), [Echoing Truth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Echoing Truth). If you want to keep it in color, go with [Perish](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Perish). [Powder Keg](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Powder Keg) and [Ratchet Bomb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ratchet Bomb) also work swimmingly.
posts.html:
Two of the cheaper ways to get around its drawback are Whiplash Trap, Echoing Truth. If you want to keep it in color, go with Perish. Powder Keg and Ratchet Bomb also work swimmingly.

posts.post_content: Yay, for a 2 drop 7/7! It has a drawback but that's easily [Stifle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stifle)d or turned to your advantage with cards like [Gather Specimens](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gather Specimens), [Leyline of Singularity](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Leyline of Singularity), [Tainted Æther](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tainted Æther), [Whiplash Trap](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Whiplash Trap), or even simple removal/burn. All in all, worth every 3/3 centaur token they get.
posts.html:
